WRITING.TITLE: No job, no juice!
WRITING.TEXT: So, I've been without a job for a bit now, and I can't justify spending money on things I don't need. I've got money for bills and such, but my home is definitely more important than vaping lol. Calling on the kindness of a stranger to help me out of a tight spot. Anything you might be giving I'm taking! Thanks for reading (:

WRITING.TITLE: ELI5: Are tattoos at home really that bad?
WRITING.TEXT: I'd like to start off by saying I'll only get tattoos professionally, but are scratchers really that bad? I don't mean your tape player engine with a guitar string, I mean a legitimate artist with a legitimate gun, but between jobs or something like that. It just seems like most people take a stance where it isn't okay no matter what. What kind of problems do people typically run into in these situations?
Don't downvote him guys, he just ran out of bombies. We've all been there

WRITING.TITLE: Panera bread!
WRITING.TEXT: Hello, I was homeless for a long time, and I know how hard it can be. I've been meaning to pass this knowledge on to people who can use it, so here it is. Panera bread! Most panera bread's donate to local food shelters, but significantly more often than you might think the shelters don't show up to take it. They wrap everything in two or three layers of plastic before they throw it out. They throw everything out at about 10 to 11pm from the previous day, so it's still fairly fresh. Panera pretty much kept me alive for a long time, so I'm hoping it can help someone else. Thanks for reading!
